Lyft wins Alphabet backing in $1bn funding round

I was mute for the first 18 years of my life. Today, the condition is called Selective Mutism. Some of you may know what it is and a lot of you may not. It was not a brain abnormality or medical condition but was considered at one point to be along the lines of a form of autism. In the 70's, the doctors chalked it up to being shy. I gestured and signed when I was in school or in public. I spoke perfect English, but only within the four walls of the home. After many years of medical research and studies, it turns out it was based on being silenced and always told to "be quiet" and to keep my mouth shut. When I got the help that was needed, I had to learn to speak up for myself and learn that it was ok to use my voice.  I started speaking outside of the home for the first time in my first year of college when I met my best friend. I even learned ASL (American Sign Language) to aid the deaf who were non verbal.
The irony is that decades later I fell into a profession where I have to speak to strangers all day for a living...go figure....
I refuse to be silenced again.
For all the women and men out there who feel silenced, it's ok to use your voice...and social media is a good bridge to getting you there...

April 1, 2015, Jeff worked with Jason in different groups

Jason is a tremendously organized and hardworking person.  He has the amazing ability to juggle a million things at once while still giving every one of his employees the personal attention that seems missing in today's corporate world.  I am not in his organization but he still gives me 30 mins face-to-face time 2 times (or more) a year to chat about where I am and where I am heading.  He is a great mentor and I always hope to be as strong of a leader as he is.  Thanks for all you do Jason!

summary: As a technology leader, I have over 20 years of experience in software engineering and development, strategic planning and IT operations.  I have architected, engineered, and operated many software solutions for product teams, customer systems, engineering platforms, and internal business units including:  Sales and Support, eCommerce, Telecom, Security, Operations and others.  I have been instrumental in building SaaS applications, integrating complex systems, running cloud scale infrastructure and driving change across a large corporation. My career to date revolves around being both a trans-formative leader and hands-on manager, backed by a strong track record of adding business value, providing strategic insight, leading execution, evaluating technology plans, building budgets, implementing IT strategies, improving security, and creating strong technical teams. I thoroughly enjoy delivering technology solutions that delight customers.  I am currently leading the transformation of information technology at the State of Arizona to help deliver better results for its citizens.  We are moving towards best in class SaaS solutions, Open Systems, and leveraging cloud providers.  From budgeting, vendor choice, and negotiations, I own the delivery of these systems for the State. Additionally, I am serving as a contributing member of the Amazon Web Services (AWS) CIO Advisory Council.
name: Jason Simpson
title: Chief Technology Officer at State of Arizona
